sentence.Network_en: After talking awhile with Taoist Wang, they realised his interest.

sentence.Network_en: Taoist Wang hesitated occasionally about these transactions for fearof offending the deities.
sentence.Network_cn: 道士也有过犹豫,怕这样会得罪了神.

sentence.Network_en: Taoist Wang let out a sigh of relief when they were finished and thanked the bricklayers.
sentence.Network_cn: 道土吐了一口气,谢过几个泥匠,再作下一步筹划.

means.word_mean: 1. an adherent of any branch of Taoism
1. of or relating to the popular Chinese religious system based on the teachings of Lao-tzu but including a pantheon of gods along with divination and magic;
2. of or relating to the philosophical system developed by Lao-tzu and Chuang-tzu advocating a simple honest life
